availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
Feby 5
The Governor approved an account of $21. to E H Tole for work done in House of Representatives certified as correct by the Sergeant at Arms
He commissioned E. B. Pope and J. M. Berill Colonel and Lieutenant Colonel of the Enrolled Militia for the County of Washington.
Also the Captains, First, Second, & Third Lieutenants of the Todd County Enrolled Militia duly elected
He pardoned John H. Gabmill convicted of Felony by the Perry Circuit Court and sentenced to two years confinement in the Penitentiary
He caused to be filed the Oath of office of Saml S. Carter Comr of Deeds fo Massachusetts.
He appointed Jas S. Phelps a Manager of the Western Lunatic Asylum in place of Jno. S. Bryan resigned.
He nominated to the Senate the following persons to be Notaries Public in the counties named, to wit:

J. D. Jones and A. C. Martin for Boyd, F. T. Fox for Boyle Robt N. Winn for Clarke, W. A. Piner and Geo. B. Hodge for Campbell F W. Alexander. for Cumberland, John Hogan for Carroll, Wm B. Wall for Daviess, Jas W. Cochran for Fayette, Thos P. Wherritt for Garrard Wm Owens Jr. for Hickman, Geo T. Beatty & L. H. Lyne for Henderson, L H Rousseau, Robt A Watts, John B. Bell, Jos A. Hamilton, H. V. Sanders R. H. Higgins, A. M. Gazlay, Jas Chambers, D. W. Wilson W. H. Beymoth, Jas Harrison, W. G. Reasor B. D Kennedy W. Marriner A. M Stout, Chas Franke W. F Bullock, Jas J. Dozier B. L. McDougall H. C. Pindell, Conrad Shroeder and Fredk. Frishe for Jefferson Jno. C Herndon, T. A Flanagan. James Ayars Jr. and Jno. P. Harrison for Kenton, Jos Harris Jr. and L A. Fuqua for McCracken, I R Lambroth for Muhlenberg, A. Ryder for Marion. Wm W. Howard for Nicholas, J. W. Muir and E Edwin McKay for Nelson, Wm H. Nall for Ohio Jno. R. Robinson for Taylor. W. P. Hays for Warren, A. C. McElroy for Washington, G. C. Gaines W. F. Vaughan, H. L Woolfork and John Brooks for Webster County. which nominations are duly confirmed
He approved and signed enrolled bills Chapters from 24 to 49 inclusive.

Feby 5
The Governor remitted the following Judgments, to wit:

row.cell: Morgan Cir. Ct. vs. Perry & Barber.
Shelby Cir. " " T. B. Cochran & others
